website_summaries.verdict: Cherry MX Blue keyswitches make this a fun and smooth typing experience, although the lack of home key indicators may irritate touch typists.
pros: Standard size keyboard with 104 Cherry MX Blue mechanical keyswitches
Blue keyswitches have great feedback sound
Works with Windows 10, 8, 7, and Vista, in addition to Linux and Mac
cons: Keys are a little on the loud side
may not be suitable for an office environment
Home keys (F and J) do not have a raised indicator for touch typists

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. This is the second keyboard I've owned with the cherry blue switches and they are the bomb; as long as you're not trying to be quiet. Don't freak by the absence of "f" and "j" bumps for finding home; instead of bumps those two keys have a greater concave across the top than the other keys. You can barely see it, but you can certainly feel it once you get accustomed. Ausgezeichnet!!!
customer_reviews.author: Skippy

customer_reviews.title: Killed by a static shock - 1 month out of warranty -1 star
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard worked great for 2 years + 1 month. I sat down at the computer this morning and touched the keyboard with a static shock (like we do as kids by rubbing our feet on the ground and shocking each other) and killed 4 of the keys! I spoke with the tech guy at Cherry Americas and he said that it is possible to damage the keyboard controller on the PCB with a static shock. WTH??? He couldn't help me because it was 1 month out of warranty. My Avant Prime keyboard lasted almost 20 years .
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I use 2 Cherry G80-3000 keyboards and a Varmilo bluetooth keyboard that have Cherry MX Blue switches. I like the Cherry G80's the most with their crisp and smooth switch action. The Varmilo is crap. The snappy, crisp sound from the G80 switches make long typing sessions more enjoyable and without any hand strain. Some cheaper mechanical keyboards I have with clone MX blue keyswitches are almost the same feeling, without the crisp sound. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Decent mechanical keyboard for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The action on this mechanical keyboard is very smooth and fast. The "click" sound is very noticeable, and for heavy-handed users, might be too loud for some office environs. After every stroke there is a noticeable ding type noise right after the clicky key stroke noise, almost like a metallic echo from the aluminum frame. A little disconcerting, at first. Overall, a decent keyboard for the price. Oddly, the keyboard came packaged in a plain brown cardboard box, like you'd get in a bulk pack shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Cocozelle

customer_reviews.title: An old fashion keyboard with lots of new features
customer_reviews.text: For people who loved the clickitty clack of the old IBM keyboards (some find it very soothing) it is perfect. Not to mention all of the modern keys added. My son, who has grown up in the computer age, starting at 7 years old, loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Eger-Herz

customer_reviews.title: A solid keyboard, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: A very solid product. I am a developer, not a gamer; I use the keyboard for typing. The MX blue switches are perfect for typing. I did replace the keys to add some color (and highlight the VI keys).
customer_reviews.author: eric gregori

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: where has this wonderful keyboard been all my life? One of my favorite Amazon purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Gnome

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this keyboard because of the blue switches. Used it all day at work after installing 40A-R - 0.4mm dampeners. I love the feel of the keys, also it's not flashy so its appropriate for work.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: So loud
customer_reviews.text: I like it for the feeling and sound of the 90s keyboard typing. However I might have to reconsider taking it back to the office since it's too loud.
customer_reviews.author: boss

customer_reviews.title: the greatest keyboard
customer_reviews.text: like most products made in German, the keyboard is quite classical, and with perfect quality. enjoy to sounds when you click the keys and i am sure you wont need another one.
customer_reviews.author: Yifan Peng

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Board, Helps with RSI
customer_reviews.text: The cherry blue keys help my RSI. Nothing else works.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Those were great keyboards. The shipping was fast. No problems whatsoever. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this keyboard, it has great mechanical switches that have a firm return and a very satisfying click, which I love. Its sturdy but not heavy. I like how I sound like an 80s airline ticket agent when I type.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Classic Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Made in Germany, this keyboard is built like a tank. Love the loud, clicky feel of the Cherry MX Blue keys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_OR

customer_reviews.title: Purely good
customer_reviews.text: Very good product from Cherry. The only few imperfections might be the loud noise while typing, and the ugly looking. (Or you can say it looks "solid", since Cherry is a Germany company.) However, when you click very button, this keyboard gives you a perfect feeling. It's definitely made for gaming such as DOTA2, LOL. etc. Of course, you may say the Cherry black switch will be better. But from my perspective, i highly recommend this G80 3000. 3000 is also a better typing keyboard. Do not hesitate to buy it if you really search for a good keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Sail

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: super keyboard, !! I can't stop coding when I start using it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacky

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Very good. Good keyboard but the sound of click is loud. I like this sound is kind of music of type.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Needed a sturdy keyboard that had that special "click" to it, this fit the bill!
customer_reviews.author: TechDripper

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This cherry keyboard is really a good one. You will begin to like type words if you use it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ziteng Gong

customer_reviews.title: I got at least 3 bad keys.
customer_reviews.text: After 6 month, I got at least 3 bad keys.
customer_reviews.author: Sicong Li

customer_reviews.title: A little problem but worth buying
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed, this keyboard is a Czech production but not Germany. The keyboard layout is inconsistent with the website photos. There are no bumps on the F and H keycap, it is hard to locate. I think it will takes a long time to adapt. Other aspects I am very satisfied, the sound is not so noisy when typing can hear a strong sense of rhythm. It's really worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: daviswei

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: GOOD u will love it. AS A DOTA PLAYER, I THINK IT IS A VERY GOOD KEYBOARD SO TRY IT.
customer_reviews.author: CUI LIPENG

customer_reviews.title: NO MARK ON F AND G
customer_reviews.text: There is no Mark on F and G , which makes it very hard to place your fingers while typing. Other than that, it does ok for an mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: These are great keyboards.
customer_reviews.text: After working from home for months, I realized that my work provided keyboard just wasn't cutting it. I wasn't sure what the difference could be. Then the epiphany, it wasn't the same because my home computer with it's backlit, Cherry MX Blue keyboard was sheer joy. buh bye, mass produced soft touch keyboard. I'm a happy girl now, clicking away, more productive, happy hands. I've only had this one a week, but will update if quality starts to degrade.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon B

customer_reviews.title: Works as PS/2
customer_reviews.text: Works as PS/2 keyboard but the USB to PS/2 adapter is not included. You can get it cheaply on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Michal Kracmk

customer_reviews.title: feels like first day using
customer_reviews.text: I have one, bought from somewhere else, in 2012 maybe or 2010, can't remember exactly. Still running solid, feels like first day using. I have dissembled the keys and watched them twice and cause the blur on print, except that, nothing to complain. I am wondering when will I be able to use my next mechanical keyboard...
customer_reviews.author: Mic G

product_meta.title: Cherry MX Blue Switch Standard Corded Keyboard - 104 Keys (G80-3000LSCEU-2)
product_meta.description: This timeless keyboard is well suited for high-volume data input for the most demanding users. Typists insist on the most sought after keyswitch in today’s market; the Cherry MX keyswitch with Gold Crosspoint contacts.
